fields.label: Book Instructions Markdown
fields.name: instructions_markdown
fields.instructions: Upload a Markdown file (.md) containing instructions for using the book that will appear at the top of the Table of Contents when expanded.

fields.label: Print View Introduction Markdown
fields.name: print_view_introduction_markdown
fields.instructions: Upload the Markdown (.md) file containing the introduction content that will appear at the beginning of each print view.

fields.label: Explorer Base URL
fields.name: explorer_base_url
fields.instructions: Enter the base URL of the Grand Tour Explorer instance that will be embedded inside this instance of the book.  The Explorer instance must be configured to support being embedded by this instance of the book.  Do not include the trailing slash.

fields.label: Book Citation Base URL
fields.name: book_citation_base_url
fields.instructions: Enter the base URL of the book that should be used by the citation-building engine to create citation URLs.  Clickable book links will use the configured URL of the WordPress installation, but if citations should use a different URL (e.g. a DOI), enter it here.  If not entered, the WordPress installation will be used.

fields.label: Enable "Print" Margin Link
fields.name: enable_print_margin_link
fields.instructions: Enable this option to add a "Print" margin link to all items that can be downloaded.  This link will open the printable view and trigger the browser's Print command, from which point the user can create a PDF of the entity.  This option should be left disabled except when creating new PDFs of updated content.

fields.label: Highlight Invalid Links and Figures
fields.name: highlight_invalid_links_and_figures
fields.instructions: If enabled, this option will identify broken book links, Explorer links, and figures and highlight them in red for easy identification.  If disabled, broken links and figures will instead be converted into normal text.  This option should be left disabled except to aid with content administration.

fields.label: Maintenance Mode
fields.name: maintenance_mode
fields.instructions: Enable Maintenance Mode to disable access to A World Made By Travel unless the visitor is logged into the WordPress admin panel.  This mode should be left off for normal production use, except for during content administration.
